titlestmt.titleproper: A Finding Aid to the Molly Saltman "Art and Artists" Interviews, 1966-1967, in the Archives of American Art
titlestmt.author: Isabelle Murphy

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-09-15 14:27:53 -0400.

did.abstract: The Molly Saltman "Art and Artists" interviews measure 2.4 linear feet and contain 62 sound recording interviews and lectures with art collectors, teachers, actors, and artists. The interviews were conducted by Molly Saltman from 1966-1967 as part of the "Art and Artists" radio series broadcast on the KPAL radio station in Palm Springs, California. Additional recordings of KPAL content and nonbroadcast content were discovered upon digitization, including a Los Angeles Art Association anniversary event and a Charles White slide lecture.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Molly Saltman in 1986.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was processed and a finding aid prepared by Isabelle Murphy in 2018.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Molly Saltman "Art and Artists" Interviews, 1966-1967. Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Researchers must obtain copyright clearance from interviewees prior to publication or airing.

userestrict.head: Terms of Use
userestrict.p: The Archives of American Art makes its archival collections available for non-commercial, educational and personal use unless restricted by copyright and/or donor restrictions, including but not limited to access and publication restrictions. AAA makes no representations concerning such rights and restrictions and it is the user's responsibility to determine whether rights or restrictions exist and to obtain any necessary permission to access, use, reproduce and publish the collections. Please refer to the Smithsonian's Terms of Use for additional information.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Molly Saltman "Art and Artists" radio program was broadcast on KPAL radio station in Palm Springs, California from November 2, 1966 to March 4, 1967 on Mondays and Wednesdays at 10:30AM. Molly Saltman (1915-2010), the producer and interviewer for this broadcast, was a well-known Palm Springs artist during this time. Specializing in abstract watercolors, her work was featured in a number of local art shows as well as exhibited in the Los Angeles County Museum of Art, the Palm Springs Desert Museum, and the Hartfield Gallery in Los Angeles. She was also closely involved with the Desert Mental Health Association and served as Chairwoman of the Jewish Family Service in Palm Springs, California.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Molly Saltman "Art and Artists" interviews measure 2.4 linear feet and contain 62 sound recording interviews and lectures with art collectors, teachers, actors, and artists. The interviews were conducted by Molly Saltman from 1966-1967 as part of the "Art and Artists" radio series broadcast on the KPAL radio station in Palm Springs, California. Additional recordings of KPAL content and nonbroadcast content were discovered upon digitization, including a Los Angeles Art Association anniversary event and a Charles White slide lecture.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Due to the small size of this collection the sound recordings are arranged as one series.

list.item: Series 1: Interviews and other recordings, circa 1963-1968 (Box 1-3, 2.4 linear feet)

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: All of the sound recordings in this collection have been copied for research access and digital copies are available in the Archives of American Art offices.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: A list of interviewees is available in all Archives of American Art offices.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains 62 interviews (only one transcribed) conducted as part of the "Art and Artists" radio broadcast series by Molly Saltman between 1966 and 1967, each approximately 20 minutes long. The interviewees include art collector Bart Lytton, teachers, such as Lorser Feitelson and Arthur Secunda, actors Vincent Price and Dennis Hopper, composer Harry Partch, and a wide-variety of artists, including Claire Falkenstein, Richard Hamilton, Jack Levine, Stanton MacDonald-Wright, Joseph Nyiri, Otto and Gertrude Natzler, June Wayne, and Charles White.

Also found in this series are other events and programs on subjects related to the contemporary art world of Southern California, and other Palm Springs local programs, which may be present due to the practice of recycling audio tape. These include an additional lecture by Edward Biberman, a slide lecture by Charles White, a Los Angeles Art Association anniversary event, a lecture an performance by composer Henri Tamianka, and a lecture by an unknown speaker on the topic of Early Western Artists. Additional local programs found include a candidate forum, a weekly report by local congressman John Tunney, and a teen program broadcast on KPAL.
Unless otherwise indicated, the content listed below consists of interviews.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The "Art and Artists" interviews are arranged alphabetically by interviewee's last name. Programs found in addition to the "Art and Artists" series are listed in logical order by name or subject; note that these additional programs typically share tapes with other content.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This lecture takes place at the Joslyn Museum and is by an unknown speaker on the subject of Early Western Artists

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Sound cassette is an access copy

did.unittitle: Charles White and Ben Horowitz, Broadcast version

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Broadcast version includes programming announcements and introductory material not present in original recording (Box 3, item 4).

did.unittitle: Los Angeles Art Association anniversary event

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Speakers include Helen Wurdeman, Nick Brigante, Peter Krasnow, and Lorser Feitelson, among others, recounting stories in the history of the association for an anniversary event. Recording is fragmentary and shares tape with multiple programs, including Gill (reel 2, side 2), Kaplan (reel 1, side 2), Partch (reel 1, side 2), and Raboff (reel 1, side 2).
